DOC.brief_summary: Abstract . Insufficient motor control mechanism transversus abdominus multifidus muscle important cause chronic nonspecific low back pain ( CNLBP ) . Recently , application sre develop generates audio vibrant stimulus response anteroposterior mediolateral rotation adapt accord subject-specific movement sensitivity . Objective . The objective study compare effect biofeedback application alternative physiotherapist feedback core stabilization training patient chronic nonspecific low back pain . Design . This study parallel group randomize control trial outcome assessment . Patients . The participant 38 patient chronic ( â‰¥12 week ) nonspecific low back pain . Interventions . Patients randomly assign receive either physiotherapist feedback Perfect Practice ( Level Belt Pro Inc. ) biofeedback . Patients group receive 12 session , 30 minute three weekly grade functional core education trial . Measurements . Primary outcome measure muscle strength ( transversus abdominus multifidus ) pain intensity ( Visual Analog Scale ) functional level ( Revised Oswestry Disability Index ) ; secondary outcome flexibility ( modified Schober test ) , range motion ( universal goniometer ) , proprioception ( Active Reposition Test ) , patient belief ( Fear Avoidance Beliefs Questionnaire ) , psychological status ( Beck Depression Index ) , quality life ( 36 Item Short-Form Health Survey questionnaire [ SF-36 ] ) . Limitations . Outcome measure muscle strength include objective assesment . Keywords . Chronic low back , core stabilization training , biofeedback , pain , function
DOC.brief_title: The Effectiveness Two Different Feedbacks Core Stabilization Education Chronic Nonspecific Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: Age 25 65 year Continuous recurrent episode pain low back last 12 week ( chronic ) No specific cause pain complaint No pathologic complaint immobility Sufficient auditory visual communication skill Sufficient knowledge Turkish language Any chronic disorder may prevent exercise , Personal history neurologic rheumatologic disease , Pregnant lactate woman , Patients malignancy lumbar comorbidity Terminal progressive disease musculoskeletal condition Surgery last 6 month Any type treatment low back pain within past 6 month
